RotheDeadAttack.synopsis: Duergar attack you after you have angered and killed the rothe.

Guard_001.synopsis: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
Guard_001.how_to_trigger: Speak to Herdmaster Skarjall - S_UND_FearfulRothe_Guard_001 (Position -668 13 442)Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -657, 4434. Walk towards the Rothe area

Rothe_001.synopsis: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.

RubbleAttack.synopsis: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.
RubbleAttack.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:First use Debug Book: Go to region > Act 1 > UND - Underdark > Fearful RotheSeveral variations in dialogue depending on what player does from here:Variation 1: Use roll amazing. Walk towards the nearby Rothe to trigger a conversation with Skarjall.  Pick 1 > 2. Then talk to the Rothe. Pick 2 and roll the dice.Variation 2: Use roll amazing. Walk towards the nearby Rothe to trigger a conversation with Skarjall.  Pick 1 > 1 > 1, roll dice, then Pick 1. Next talk to the Rothe. Pick 2 and roll dice.Variation 3: Walk towards the nearby Rothe to trigger a conversation with Skarjall.  Pick Leave. Then Ctrl+Shift+K on the Cave-In (the rubble behind the Rothe).

Guard_001_Dead.synopsis: SwD with the Taskmaster in the Fearful Rothe situation. He might tell you about an ancient forge lying further inside Grymforge.
Guard_001_Dead.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead MostPowerful4. infiniteAp5. goto -668.127; 13.192; 4426. Skip the cinematic by choosing "leave"7. CTRL-Shift-K on Skarjall.8. Use Speak with Dead on Skarjall

Guard_002.synopsis: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
Guard_002.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -669.41, 13.33, 439.814. Skip cinematic by choosing "leave"5. Talk with Gundril

Rothe_002.synopsis: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).

Guard_003.synopsis: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
Guard_003.how_to_trigger: To trigger ROTHE ARE AFRAID, NOT MET1. Start the game.2. Use Recon command: "loadlevel WLD_Main_A"3. goto -677.266; 13.025; 441.9 and leave the dialog with herdmaster.4. Talk with Morgya.To trigger ROTHE ARE AFRAID, MET1. Start the game.2. Use Recon command: "loadlevel WLD_Main_A"3. goto -677.266; 13.025; 441.9 and leave the dialog with herdmaster.4. Talk with Morgya.5. Talk to Morgya again.To trigger ROTHE ARE DEAD1. Start the game.2. Use Recon command: "loadlevel WLD_Main_A"3. goto -677.266; 13.025; 441.9 and leave the dialog with herdmaster.4. Use Recon command: "SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_FearfulRothe_State_RotheAreDead"5. Talk with Morgya.To trigger ROTHE CALM, RUBBLE STILL THERE1. Start the game.2. Use Recon command: "loadlevel WLD_Main_A"3. goto -677.266; 13.025; 441.9 and leave the dialog with herdmaster4. Use Recon command: "addDebugSpell Shout_SpeakWithAnimals" and "infiniteAp"5. Talk with the Rothe in front of the herdmaster and convince it to attack the rubble.6. Rapidly talk with Morgya while rubbles are still up.To trigger ROTHE CALM, RUBBLE REMOVED...

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After analyzing the session descriptions and how they are triggered, several ordering and exclusivity relationships emerge. First, the animal (rothe) encounter in 'Rothe_001' is the initial contact with the beast. If the player fails to calm the rothe and instead kills it, the follow‐up consequence is that the duergar attack in 'RotheDeadAttack'. In other words, 'Rothe_001' must come before 'RotheDeadAttack'. Second, the conversation with the taskmaster in 'Guard_001' initiates the Fearful Rothe situation. If the player then kills or otherwise removes the living taskmaster, a separate dialogue thread 'Guard_001_Dead' becomes available. This makes 'Guard_001' a necessary precursor for 'Guard_001_Dead' and, because they represent mutually exclusive states (the taskmaster is either alive or dead in a given playthrough), they cannot both occur in the same run. Third, in at least one variation (see the how‐to‐trigger for 'RubbleAttack'), the player acts within the fearful rothe scenario – after encountering or interacting with the taskmaster or the rothe – by attacking/destroying the rubble wall. Therefore, we set an ordering dependency where the fearful rothe encounter (represented in part by 'Guard_001') must logically precede 'RubbleAttack'. Other sessions such as 'Guard_002', 'Rothe_002', and 'Guard_003' provide additional dialogues that are state‐dependent (for example, depending on whether the animals are panicked, calm, or dead) but are not clearly tied in a strict cause–effect sequence with the sessions above, so they are not included in the ordering constraints here.

RotheDeadAttack_3.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack_3.text: The hell's wrong with you? Drugnin' hoon!
RotheDeadAttack_3.context: NodeContext: Clan-sen: like it sounds. (Diuergar of another clan) Drugh = fuck. DROOG. (RHymes with hood, not food.)

RotheDeadAttack_1.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack_1.text: I meant to calm them, not rile them up.

RotheDeadAttack_0.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack_0.text: Don't get surly with me. Those beasts were out of control.

RotheDeadAttack_4.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RotheDeadAttack_4.text: Shit-for-brains. All that adamantine within reach - and you done screwed me over!

RotheDeadAttack_2.speaker: Player
RotheDeadAttack_2.text: I've gained a taste for rothé meat. I don't see the problem.

Guard_001_0.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_0.text: You gonna cane 'em or what? Time those rothé got to work.

Guard_001_32.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_32.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001_32.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001_58.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_58.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001_15.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_15.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

Guard_001_112.speaker: Player
Guard_001_112.text: You want me to cane these poor beasts?

Guard_001_46.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_46.text: Gettin' cramps in my arm from trying to whip the drugnin' beasts back to work.
Guard_001_46.context: NodeContext: DRUG-ning - 'fuckin' beasts back to work...'

Guard_001_12.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_12.text: Now get to the canin', before I thrash you instead.

Guard_001_111.speaker: Player
Guard_001_111.text: Almost sounds like you're asking for help, if I ignore your tone.

Guard_001_107.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_107.text: And it sounds like your arse wants for a lashing, the way you talk out of it.

Guard_001_81.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_81.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

Guard_001_120.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_120.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.

Guard_001_132.speaker: Player
Guard_001_132.text: I know these creatures well. You should give them another lash of the cane.

Guard_001_69.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_69.text: You got your orders. I'm not taking one more whack.

Guard_001_31.speaker: Lae'zel
Guard_001_31.text: Watch it - take the cane to those beasts again and this standoff turns to slaughter.

Guard_001_139.speaker: Shadowheart
Guard_001_139.text: Fool. He should've used the threat of the cane over the cane itself. Now those beasts are ready to charge.
Guard_001_139.context: NodeContext: Disdainful. A heavy-handed duergar foreman's been mistreating his beasts of burden.

Guard_001_79.speaker: Karlach
Guard_001_79.text: If he winds up, I'm gonna snap his neck - if the rothé don't stomp his lights out first.

Guard_001_84.speaker: Astarion
Guard_001_84.text: Just as well, perhaps. Beat anything for long enough and it'll snap.

Guard_001_16.speaker: Wyll
Guard_001_16.text: Hold your tongue. Those rothé are ready to blow - and you'll be lighting the fuse.

Guard_001_49.speaker: Player
Guard_001_49.text: Please. Are you so feeble you can't deliver a single lash?

Guard_001_119.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_119.text: Shit. You calling me weak, jargh?

Guard_001_3.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall cracks the cane at the rothe with his last NggghHA!NodeContext: Cracks a whip at his beast of burden.

Guard_001_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The duergar canes the rothe and they go into a frenzy, ready to attack everyone near.

Guard_001_2.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_2.text: Gh'rack - you knew I'd rile them up. I'll split you from head to hole for this!
Guard_001_2.context: NodeContext: GRACK! (Damn it!) Angry and aggressive.

Guard_001_34.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_34.text: You got no need to know, and I got no need to tell. So get to caning, or to leaving.

Guard_001_7.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_7.text: *Your eye finds the source of the gleam: a small mote of black metal. Adamantine.*

Guard_001_1.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_1.text: *You remember blacksmiths speaking of it in hushed awe - the hardest substance known to exist, used for the finest weapons and armour.*

Guard_001_30.speaker: Lae'zel
Guard_001_30.text: I saw it too - adamantine. The forge is behind the rubble. And the duergar mean to lay claim to it.

Guard_001_98.speaker: Shadowheart
Guard_001_98.text: Adamantine. We must be nearing the forge.

Guard_001_29.speaker: Karlach
Guard_001_29.text: Adamantine. Bet we're near the forge. Wonder if I could melt that stuff...

Guard_001_68.speaker: Player
Guard_001_68.text: You want to access the forge, is that it? I've already been there.

Guard_001_70.speaker: Player
Guard_001_70.text: I know what you're after. There's adamantine back there, isn't there?

Guard_001_88.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_88.text: Stuff's no joke. Stronger than steel, rarer than mithral. It ain't mined - it's made.
Guard_001_88.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL sighs, pulls a rock of admanatine from his rear pocket,  and holds it out. About the size and shape of a small rock. He then puts it back in his pocket.

NodeContext: Sighs before line

Guard_001_5.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_5.text: There's an adamantine forge back there, sure as shittin'.

Guard_001_52.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_52.text: Don't get any smart ideas - that forge is clan property. But get the beasts moving and I'll toss some coin your way.

Guard_001_117.speaker: Player
Guard_001_117.text: You can't keep me from the forge - I've already found it.

Guard_001_50.speaker: Player
Guard_001_50.text: Let's see what I can do.

Guard_001_103.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_103.text: Go on, then - light a fire under the buggers.

Guard_001_125.speaker: Player
Guard_001_125.text: Sounds like your problem. Figure it out yourself.

Guard_001_60.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_60.text: Drugh. Should'a told you to piss off when I had the chance.

Guard_001_8.speaker: Player
Guard_001_8.text: Thanks for the tip. Once you're dead, I'll have that forge to myself.

Guard_001_24.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_24.text: Drugnin' hoon. I'll split you from head to hole!

Guard_001_90.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_90.text: Just splittin' then? Suit your damn self.

Guard_001_72.speaker: Player
Guard_001_72.text: Out of my way. I'll take care of the rothé.

Guard_001_25.speaker: Player
Guard_001_25.text: You're after adamantine? That stuff's too fine for your lot. Best you stick to scrap iron.

Guard_001_73.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_73.text: Just because we don't waste time prettifying things doesn't mean we can't make use of good ore.

Guard_001_121.speaker: Astarion
Guard_001_121.text: Well would you look at that. The forge can't be far now.
Guard_001_121.context: NodeContext: Notices a glittering spot of precious metal

Guard_001_64.speaker: Wyll
Guard_001_64.text: Adamantine. That forge must be within spitting distance.

Guard_001_109.speaker: Gale
Guard_001_109.text: You saw it too? The fabled adamantine forge is around the bend. We just have a few snags to untangle.

Guard_001_116.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_116.text: *The glint fades before your eye finds its source.*

Guard_001_123.speaker: Player
Guard_001_123.text: You want my help? Then you will tell me what's back there.

Guard_001_48.speaker: Player
Guard_001_48.text: You want my help? Then you will tell me what's back there.

Guard_001_23.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_23.text: Adamantine. Stuff's no joke. Stronger than steel, rarer than mithral. It ain't mined - it's made.
Guard_001_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: TASKMASTER SKARJALL pulls a small rock of admanatine from his rear pocket and holds it out. He then puts it back in his pocket.

Guard_001_13.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_13.text: Shit. Sooner give a lurker a lickjob.

Guard_001_126.speaker: Player
Guard_001_126.text: Examine the rubble for anything unusual.

Guard_001_124.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_124.text: *You see only the most mundane of rocks and minerals.*

Guard_001_113.speaker: Player
Guard_001_113.text: Call on the parasite, connect with the taskmaster. What does he seek?

Guard_001_134.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_134.text: You're one of Nere's, eh? Don't go bursting those head-veins - I ain't joined your bat-brained cult.
Guard_001_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to mindmeld with the taskmaster but fails.

Guard_001_63.speaker: Player
Guard_001_63.text: Leave it to me. I'll show these deep rothé who's in charge.

Guard_001_47.speaker: Player
Guard_001_47.text: Rest your arm. I'll put these beasts to work.

Guard_001_39.speaker: Gale
Guard_001_39.text: Another lick of the cane and those rothés are going on a rampage.

Guard_001_53.speaker: Player
Guard_001_53.text: You want to thrash me? Go on, then.

Guard_001_43.speaker: Player
Guard_001_43.text: Best if you stop whinging and get those whiskers trimmed.

Guard_001_141.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_141.text: Volunteering, are you? Well we ain't getting paid to flirt. Might not get paid at all, with this mess.

Guard_001_10.speaker: Player
Guard_001_10.text: A brute? Is that what you see?

Guard_001_118.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_118.text: Sure as shittin'. That orc blood makes you damn near feral.

Guard_001_80.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_80.text: There's no denying the blood-call. And there's no shame in it. Now go on, brute, and get these beasts moving.

Guard_001_75.speaker: Player
Guard_001_75.text: A brute? Is that what you see?

Guard_001_100.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_100.text: Sure as shittin'. One look from you'd send half this place runnin'. Bloody handy, that.

Guard_001_28.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_28.text: Sure as shittin' you could deal with some stubborn rothe. Go on, get 'em moving.

Guard_001_114.speaker: Player
Guard_001_114.text: Perhaps you should just try asking them instead.

Guard_001_45.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_45.text: Oh aye, maybe say pretty please as well? Throw in a curtsy? Don't be soft.

Guard_001_22.speaker: Player
Guard_001_22.text: Show the animals some respect. Then you may get results.

Guard_001_27.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_27.text: Think if you respect a turd it'll smell any sweeter? Waste of bloody time.

Guard_001_62.speaker: Player
Guard_001_62.text: A duergar asking a dwarf for help? Never thought I'd see the day.

Guard_001_130.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_130.text: Keep this between us or you'll never see another day - got it?

Guard_001_74.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_74.text: Let 'em clear the rubble. Then you'll get what's coming to you.

Guard_001_77.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_77.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.

Guard_001_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

Guard_001_66.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_66.text: I almost feel bad about this.
Guard_001_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

Guard_001_78.speaker: Player
Guard_001_78.text: What in the hells? I helped you, and now you want me dead?

Guard_001_17.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_17.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

Guard_001_137.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_137.text: There's an adamantine forge back there, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

Guard_001_42.speaker: Player
Guard_001_42.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

Guard_001_87.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_87.text: How about you stop making messes? Grab a cane and whip these beasts into shape.

Guard_001_95.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_95.text: You - grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001_95.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001_97.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_97.text: Grab a cane and get these rothé moving!

Guard_001_101.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_101.text: Get to caning or to leaving, hoon.

Guard_001_104.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_104.text: Well lookie there - and not one crack of the cane.

Guard_001_94.speaker: Player
Guard_001_94.text: What in the hells are you turning on me for?

Guard_001_110.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_110.text: Just you wait for what happens next.

Guard_001_122.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_122.text: If you ain't helping, piss off.

Rothe_001_4.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Deep rothe is unsettled - snorting and shuffling, shaking its head etc.

Rothe_001_6.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_6.text: No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!

Rothe_001_52.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_52.text: You're just like them. Won't let you push me around. Any of you.
Rothe_001_52.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals - shocked and angry after being struck. About to turn hostile.

Rothe_001_18.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_18.text: What has you in such a state?

Rothe_001_49.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_49.text: Old death. Fire. I can smell it. It is too much, too much. Anger - can't hold it in!

Rothe_001_24.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_24.text: Breathe. Focus. If you strike, your masters will destroy the herd.

Rothe_001_45.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_45.text: All right. We will work. We will do as we're told. We will clear the way.

Rothe_001_32.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_32.text: Lies. You're just like them, with their canes and shouting. No more!

Rothe_001_27.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_27.text: You were made to serve. This is your meaning. Remove the rubble, as you were told.

Rothe_001_1.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_1.text: Yes. You are right. There is work, only work. I will clear the rock.

Rothe_001_55.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_55.text: Give in to your rage and avenge your pain. Don't strike us all, just your masters.

Rothe_001_33.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_33.text: Yes. They made the pain. Now they feel it!
Rothe_001_33.context: NodeContext: She's been egged on by the player to attack her duergar handlers.

Rothe_001_9.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_9.text: No. Everyone hurts us. Now we hurt everyone back!
Rothe_001_9.context: NodeContext: Angry. Everyone's taking advantage of her.

Rothe_001_8.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_8.context: NodeContext: Sound FX only - do not record.

Rothe_001_38.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_38.text: *The deep rothé's agitation intensifies. It is primed to attack.*

Rothe_001_31.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_31.context: NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Rothe_001_42.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_42.text: Nod to the rubble. Perhaps the creature will break through.

Rothe_001_26.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_26.text: *The rothé pauses, then growls in assent.*

Rothe_001_36.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_36.text: Duergar can't hurt anymore. Will wait until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_001_36.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals line - bestial and fragmented. Glad that the duergar are gone (ether dead or ordered elsewhere)

Rothe_001_30.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_30.text: Do me a favour, smash through the rubble before you go.

Rothe_001_14.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_14.text: You helped me. I help you.

Rothe_001_39.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_39.text: Got to move rock. Only the rock.

Rothe_001_40.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_40.text: Will find a safe place. No more hurt.

Rothe_001_41.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_41.text: No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!

Rothe_001_46.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_46.text: Don't want to move rocks. Too much pain, too much noise.

Rothe_001_57.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Animal should seem skittish and possibly dangerous - fight or flight instinct

Rothe_001_5.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_5.text: *The creature is disturbed, its breath quickened by anger and fear.*

Rothe_001_37.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_37.text: *The rothé utters an angry bellow and charges.*
Rothe_001_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rothe reacts to being struck and turns hostile. Actual hit can be hidden off-screen.NodeContext: Row-thay

Rothe_001_23.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_23.text: Display your palms and murmur soft, low reassurances.

Rothe_001_3.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_3.text: Meet its eyes. Show it how calm you are - all is well.

Rothe_001_54.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_54.text: *The rothé seems calmer in your presence.*
Rothe_001_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: The rothé snorts and shuffles on its hoovesNodeContext: Row-thay

Rothe_001_2.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_2.text: *Its eyes flicker towards the duergar, burning with raw, bestial rage.*

Rothe_001_51.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_51.text: Encourage it to breathe, and get back to work. There is only the work.

Rothe_001_25.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_25.text: *The rothé looks at you with big, soft eyes. Then it lowers its head obediently.*

Rothe_001_12.speaker: Player
Rothe_001_12.text: Incline your head towards the duergar. They're the real problem.

Rothe_001_44.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_44.text: *The rothé regards its duergar captors balefully, then utters a deep, angry bellow.*

Rothe_001_10.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_10.text: *No good. The rothé is more agitated than ever.*
Rothe_001_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Animal gets more agitated - combat imminent.NodeContext: row-thay

Rothe_001_0.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_001_0.text: *It utters an angry bellow and charges.*

RubbleAttack_9.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_9.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack_10.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_10.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack_13.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_13.text: What in the hells? What's this all about?

RubbleAttack_18.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_18.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

RubbleAttack_3.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_3.text: Stand down. I'm not trying to take anything.

RubbleAttack_12.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_12.text: Empty words, jargh. Adamantine's precious, and I'm not the sharing type.

RubbleAttack_14.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_14.text: You've started a fight you can't win.

RubbleAttack_15.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_15.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.

RubbleAttack_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

RubbleAttack_7.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_7.text: I almost feel bad about this.
RubbleAttack_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack_6.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_6.text: What in the hells? I helped you, and now you want me dead?

RubbleAttack_17.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_17.text: There's an adamantine forge back there, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.
RubbleAttack_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Jargh = fool. ZHARGH! Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack_0.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_0.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.
RubbleAttack_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Jargh = fool. ZHARGH! Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack_16.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_16.text: Should've known not to help a miserable excuse for a duergar. Serves me right.

RubbleAttack_4.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_4.text: I can't say I'm surprised. Hoped you'd be smarter, but not surprised.

RubbleAttack_2.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack_2.text: What can I say? I'm a creature of habit.

RubbleAttack_1.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack_1.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

Guard_001_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_Dead_17.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Guard_001_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Guard_001_Dead_11.text: What is so special about the forge back there?

Guard_001_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Guard_001_Dead_0.text: How long have you been here?

Guard_001_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Guard_001_Dead_1.text: Did True Soul Nere send you after the forge?

Guard_001_Dead_24.speaker: Player
Guard_001_Dead_24.text: Why aren't you helping dig out Nere?

Guard_001_Dead_25.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001_Dead_25.text: Don't care... about True Soul... only coin...

Guard_001_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_Dead_21.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Guard_001_Dead_22.speaker: Narrator
Guard_001_Dead_22.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Guard_002_0.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_0.text: Here to help? Talk to Skarjall. Here to gawk? Find a ledge to fall off.
Guard_002_0.context: NodeContext: 'I just work here.' Skarjall = skar-jall, just like it sounds (duergar in charge)

Guard_002_1.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_1.text: Nicely handled. Those rothé old sweethearts of yours or something?
Guard_002_1.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002_4.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_4.text: Pity I got to split you - that forge ain't for sharing.

Guard_002_8.speaker: Player
Guard_002_8.text: I calmed the rothé, and now you want me dead?

Guard_002_2.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_2.text: You think we're letting you near that forge? You're as dumb as you are stupid.

Guard_002_6.speaker: Player
Guard_002_6.text: Go ahead. We'll see who ends up split.

Guard_002_3.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_3.text: And I thought deep rothé stank while they were alive...
Guard_002_3.context: NodeContext: Disgust. Zero empathy. The animals being supervised died somehow.

Guard_002_5.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_5.text: You got a knack. Won't be long before the beasts break through.
Guard_002_5.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002_7.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_7.text: Nere was soft. No reason for you to strut about like a damn hero.

Guard_002_9.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002_9.text: Don't see you helping. Best you find a ledge and jump.

Rothe_002_2.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep rothe is unsettled and anxiousNodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Rothe_002_3.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep rothe is calmNodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Rothe_002_4.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_4.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002_4.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002_8.speaker: Player
Rothe_002_8.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002_0.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_0.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

Rothe_002_7.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_7.context: NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Rothe_002_12.speaker: Player
Rothe_002_12.text: Nod to the rubble. Perhaps the creature will break through.

Rothe_002_9.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_9.text: It's all right. I'm all right. Have to move rocks.

Rothe_002_10.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_10.text: Don't like it here. Grey ones hurt hide!
Rothe_002_10.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals. Bestial and panicked. Think a horse that senses a predator

Rothe_002_11.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_11.text: Don't want to move rocks. Bad smells. Death smells.
Rothe_002_11.context: NodeContext: Speak with animals. Bestial and panicked. Think a horse that senses a predator

Rothe_002_13.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep rothe is unsettled and anxiousNodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Guard_003_0.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_0.text: Fantastic work. You're a right master of beasts.

Guard_003_4.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_4.text: But ain't no one but clan need to be using the forge back there - and we can't have you blabbing!

Guard_003_1.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_1.text: Bloody deep rothé. All the hassle of getting them up here. Now they won't work!

Guard_003_2.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_2.text: Hrrmph. Them deep rothé fought better than most gnomes, I'll give them that.

Guard_003_3.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_3.text: Halfway there, I'd wager. Now the beasts need to finish the job.

Guard_003_5.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003_5.text: Would've thought these beast were too stupid to get scared.
